author: Staff Reporter
text:
Reinforced polymers and sheds were gutted in a fire at a factory in Pattaravakkam, Ambattur on Saturday. The fire, which broke out due to an electrical short-circuit around 1.30 a.m. was brought under control by 6 a.m.

Around five fire tenders and water tankers from Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board were pressed into service to douse the flames. No one was injured, Tamil Nadu Fire and Rescue Services personnel said. The gutted polymers and sheds are said to cost around five lakh, the personnel added.
title: Fire at factory in Pattaravakkam
